page.title: 06SHABBAT _ PART TWO
page.content:
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF MICHAEL ROSENHEAD (CONTINUED)
When Shabbat is over we say a prayer which is called Havdalah. This is a small service for the going out of Shabbat. There are three prayers we say: one for the wine we drink, one for the spices we smell and one for the candle we light. This candle is plaited and to put it out we dip it in the wine. Then we sing the song of Elijah and Shabbat is out. We are an Orthodox Jewish family, which means that we keep our religion strictly. There are also Jewish people who do not observe their religion as strictly as we do.
Michael Rosenhead, age 11.
